required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Vestibular Socket Therapy (VST) Versus Partial Extraction Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: Vestibular Socket Therapy (VST) Versus Partial Extraction Therapy (PET) for Treating Fresh Extraction Sites With Thin Labial Plate of Bone With Immediate Implant Placement in the Esthetic Zone: A Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
The current randomized clinical trial aimed to compare the VST versus Partial Extraction Therapy (PET) for immediate implant placement in the esthetic zone in class I fresh extraction sites.
The primary outcome was the assessment of vertical dimensional changes in peri-implant soft tissue margin.
The secondary outcome was the assessment of radiographic changes in the thickness of the facial peri-implant tissues.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in the peri-implant facial tissue thickness
primary_outcome.description: through CBCT images (Carestream 8000D- Carestream Dental) that were taken at baseline and 6 months postoperatively

intervention.intervention_name: Class I extractions sites received immediate implants using the Vestibular Socket Therapy
intervention.description: A 1-cm-long vestibular access incision was made using a 15c blade 3 to 4 mm apical to the mucogingival junction at the related socket. A subperiosteal tunnel was created connecting the socket orifice and the vestibular access incision

intervention.intervention_name: class I extractions sites received immediate implants using the Partial Extraction Therapy
intervention.description: the hopeless tooth was decoronated 1 mm coronal to the gingival margin using a diamond bur. Then, the facial root segment was separated from the rest of the root using a Lindemann bur in gentle mesiodistal sweeping strokes from the gingival margin to the apex of the root, aiming to separate the palatal and the labial root segments.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- single hopeless maxillary tooth in the esthetic zone
- non-smokers
- systemically healthy
- Class I extraction sites
Exclusion Criteria:
- smoking
- Class II and III extraction sites
- hopeless teeth with acute infection or vertical/horizontal root fracture

responsible_party.investigator_title: Assistant lecturer of DPH and Clinical statistician
